Key Match Events: The Mavericks received contributions on both ends of the floor from several players who are usually confined to a specific role, but find themselves shouldering more responsibility to keep the team afloat.

Klay Thompson and Jaden Hardy displayed their ability to catch a groove from the 3-point line in rapid fashion, both knocking down three consecutive 3-pointers to help Dallas establish momentum against the Lakers.
Spencer Dinwiddie was a consistent scoring threat against his former team, continuing a trend that’s developed throughout the season when he’s been called upon to enter the starting lineup.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Jason Kidd emphasized the importance of the 'next man up' mentality whenever a player is expected to miss a significant amount of time due to injury.

Kidd has received meaningful contributions from several players, including Quentin Grimes, who has been given the freedom to put the ball on the floor and serve as a playmaker to create scoring opportunities.
Post-Match Reflections: Jason Kidd said, 'Give this group some time,' after the team's victory over the Los Angeles Lakers.
Kidd stated that the team is 'learning each other' and 'asking guys to change their role to make a pivot and guys have been in a positive state.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks are big proponents of the 'next man up' mentality whenever a player is expected to miss a significant amount of time due to injury.
Dallas has a 1-6 record without the versatile forward P.J. Washington, whose do-it-all skillset sets him apart from his teammates.
Others: Luka Doncic will likely be out for the rest of January, and Kyrie Irving could be out for the next two to six games due to injury.
